chapter.title: Capacity Planning (C/P) Module
chapter.para:
This module enables you to analyze the impact of the
production plans
in capacity planning Production Plan on machine and labor Capacity. The following categories will be covered:

listitem.para: Work Center Capacity and Load
Planner Code Analysis
Item Production

section.title: Master Information
section.para: This is the section where you define Master Information for the module.

section.title: C/P Reports
section.para: This module offers a number of reports.

section.title: Time-Phased Load by Work Center
section.para: To view time-phased load by Work Center, select the "Time-Phased Load by Work Center" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying time-phased load by Work Center, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display time-phased load by Work Center for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose time-phased load by Work Center you want to display.
Select the Calendar you want to use for the report.
Associated Calendar periods will be displayed.
Select as many periods as you want to display. Selected periods correspond to Calendar specified in the "Calendar" field.

Select individual periods or groups of periods together. To select an individual period, highlight the period using your mouse button. The period is now selected. To select a sequence of periods, highlight the first in the sequence using your mouse button. Then, holding down the SHIFT key on your keyboard, highlight the last period in the sequence. The entire sequence is now selected. To select periods that are out of sequence (e.g., January, April, July, October), highlight the first period in the group. Then, holding down the CTRL key on your keyboard, highlight the next period you want to select. Continue highlighting periods with the CTRL key depressed until all desired periods are selected. The entire group is now selected.
Display lists time-phased load by Work Center, using the specified parameters.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
Start date and end date must be entered for calculation to proceed. Results will be displayed in the "Load" display.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.para: Right-clicking on an Item in the Load list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title: Time-Phased Demand by Planner Code
section.para: To view time-phased demand by Planner Code, select the "Time-Phased Demand by Planner Code" option. The following screen will appear:
When displaying time-phased demand by Planner Code, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display time-phased demand by Planner Code for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose time-phased demand by Planner Code you want to display.
Select to display time-phased demand for all Planner Codes.
Specify Planner Code whose time-phased demand you want to display.
Enter a Planner Code pattern to select a range of Planner Codes.
Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions"Topic: Pattern Matching with Regular Expressions".
Select to display Inventory Units of Measure.
Select to display Capacity Units of Measure.
Capacity Units: Select to display Alternate Capacity Units of Measure.
Select the Calendar you want to use for the report.
Associated Calendar periods will be displayed.
Select as many periods as you want to display. Selected periods correspond to Calendar specified in the "Calendar" field.

Select individual periods or groups of periods together. To select an individual period, highlight the period using your mouse button. The period is now selected. To select a sequence of periods, highlight the first in the sequence using your mouse button. Then, holding down the SHIFT key on your keyboard, highlight the last period in the sequence. The entire sequence is now selected. To select periods that are out of sequence (e.g., January, April, July, October), highlight the first period in the group. Then, holding down the CTRL key on your keyboard, highlight the next period you want to select. Continue highlighting periods with the CTRL key depressed until all desired periods are selected. The entire group is now selected.
Display lists time-phased demand by Planner Code, using the specified parameters.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
Start date and end date must be entered for calculation to proceed. Results will be displayed in the "Demand" display.
Runs the report associated with this screen.
Select to submit report to the Batch Manager. For additional information, see the Submitting Reports and Jobs to the Batch Manager"Topic: Submitting Reports and Jobs to the Batch Manager".

section.para: Right-clicking on an Item in the Demand list enables you to select from the following menu options:

Select the Calendar you want to use for the report.

Select as many periods as you want to display. Selected periods correspond to Calendar specified in the "Calendar" field.

Select individual periods or groups of periods together. To select an individual period, highlight the period using your mouse button. The period is now selected. To select a sequence of periods, highlight the first in the sequence using your mouse button. Then, holding down the SHIFT key on your keyboard, highlight the last period in the sequence. The entire sequence is now selected. To select periods that are out of sequence (e.g., January, April, July, October), highlight the first period in the group. Then, holding down the CTRL key on your keyboard, highlight the next period you want to select. Continue highlighting periods with the CTRL key depressed until all desired periods are selected. The entire group is now selected.
Display lists time-phased production by Item, using the specified parameters.

section.para: Right-clicking on a Planner Code in the Production list enables you to select from the following menu options:

section.title: Capacity Buffer Status by Work Center
section.para: The capacity buffer status display provides information on your current capacity buffer levels. Capacity buffers apply to Work Centers. The capacity buffer screen enables us to view the current load in relation to a definable number of days of capacity. Keep in mind that buffer status information will only be displayed on days when the Buffer Management system is run. If you find your displays show no information, this probably means Buffer Management has not been run.
To view capacity buffer status by Work Center, select the "Capacity Buffer Status by Work Center" option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Capacity Buffer Status by Work Center

note.para: When the buffer status for a Work Center hits 66 or higher, the status number will become red. By highlighting lines which are "red hot," the system is informing you which should be acted on immediately. The best remedy for red hot Item Sites is to expedite any associated Work Orders or Purchase Orders.

section.para: When displaying capacity buffer statuses by Work Center, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display capacity buffer statuses for all Work Centers.
Specify Work Center whose Inventory buffer status you want to display.
Select to display capacity buffer statuses for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose capacity buffer statuses you want to display.
Specify the maximum number of days worth of Work Center load you want to view, using the arrows to the right of the field. This is required information
You must enter a value greater than 0 to generate buffer status information. The system uses the following equation to determine the capacity buffer status for a Work Center:
(Total Setup + Total Run) / (Max Days Load x Daily Capacity) = Buffer (%)

note.para: By default, the display will sort Work Centers by buffer status in descending order. In other words, Work Centers with the highest buffer status will appear at the top of the list; Work Centers with the lowest buffer status will appear at the bottom.

listitem.para: Display lists capacity buffer status by Work Center, using the specified parameters.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
